intro: Cyphia elata, commonly known as the slender cyphia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, slender stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Cyphia elata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture.
